alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 3:52AM CDT until March 27 at 8:21PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Missouri... Current River near Doniphan affecting Ripley County. For the Current River...including Doniphan...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Current River near Doniphan. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flood homes in Doniphan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM CDT Sunday was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 01/31/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
